intro: Muhlenbergia cinna, commonly known as the silky muhlenbergia, is a perennial grass native to the United States. It is characterized by its fine, silver-blue foliage and delicate, panicle-like inflorescences. The plant thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils. It is often used in ornamental landscaping for its ornate appearance and drought tolerance. Muhlenbergia cinna is also valued for its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
